revised_title: Edgar Hartley Kettle: A Pioneering Pathologist and Teacher
tldr: Edgar Hartley Kettle was a renowned pathologist and teacher who made significant contributions to the fields of pathology, silicosis, and tuberculosis research. He was a dedicated educator and played a crucial role in organizing and developing pathology departments in various medical institutions. Kettle's work on silicosis and its relation to tubercular infection was groundbreaking, and his dedication to medical education and research left a lasting impact on the field of pathology.
